name_text.description: Text for the Chrome Web Store listing and window titles

wsLongName.message: TabFern tab manager and backup tool
wsLongName.description: The long name at the top of the Chrome Web Store window

wsShortName.description: The short name, for the TabFern window title bar

wsSettings.description: The title for the Settings window

tooltip_text.description: Text for tooltips, other than menu tooltips

ttEditTab.description: Tooltip for the pencil button on a tab's tree entry

ttDeleteTab.description: Tooltip for the X button on a tab's tree entry

ttEditWin.description: Tooltip for the pencil button on a window's tree entry

ttCloseWin.description: Tooltip for the close button on a window's tree entry

ttDeletewin.description: Tooltip for the X button on a window's tree entry

dlgpNewWindowName.description: Prompt for the user to enter a window name

dlgpTabNote.description: Prompt for the user to enter a note for a tab

title.example: (this is the title of the Web page open in that tab)

dlgpDeleteWindow.description: Prompt for whether the user wants to delete a window

title.example: (this is the title of the window that will be deleted)

dlgpDeleteTab.description: Prompt for whether the user wants to delete a tab

title.example: (this is the title of the tab that will be deleted)

dlgpDeleteTabAndWindow.description: Prompt for whether the user wants to delete the last tab in a window

title.example: (this is the title of the tab that will be deleted)

dlgpCloseAudibleWindow.message: Close window "$TITLE$"?  It is currently playing music.
dlgpCloseAudibleWindow.description: Prompt for whether the user wants to delete a window that is playing music (audible).

title.example: (this is the title of the window that will be closed)

dlgpTextToReplace.description: Prompt for the user to enter text to replace

dlgpReplacementText.description: Prompt for the user to enter text to replace

dlgYesHTML.description: HTML code for a 'Yes' dialog button.  Includes a <span class="accel" if there is an accelerator key.

dlgYesAccelerator.description: Accelerator (access key) for a 'Yes' dialog button.

dlgNoHTML.description: HTML code for a 'No' dialog button.  Includes a <span class="accel" if there is an accelerator key.

dlgNoAccelerator.description: Accelerator (access key) for a 'No' dialog button.

dlgCancelHTML.description: HTML code for a 'Cancel' dialog button.  Includes a <span class="accel" if there is an accelerator key.

dlgCancelAccelerator.description: Accelerator (access key) for a 'Yes' dialog button.

dlgDoNotAskAgainHTML.message: Don't ask again (<abbr title="You can change this in Settings | Behaviour">note</abbr>)
dlgDoNotAskAgainHTML.description: HTML code for the 'Do not ask again' checkbox.  The (<abbr>...</abbr>) part is an explanation that pops up when the user hovers the mouse over the word 'note'.

labelUnsaved.description: The label in the tree for an unsaved window

labelSavedTabs.description: The label in the tree for a saved window without a user-provided name

labelRecoveredTabs.description: The label in the tree for a window that was autosaved

labelRecoveredTabsPostfix.description: Added to the end of the label in the tree for a window that was autosaved

labelUnknownTitle.description: Label for a tab's tree node if we can't find a title for it

labelBlankTabTitle.description: Label for a tab's tree node if we can't find a title for it on an update

menu_text.description: Text for the hamburger and context menus

menuSplitTest.description: The item in the hamburger (≡) menu for a split test.

menuJasmineTests.description: The menu item to run tests using the 'Jasmine' program.

menuReload.description: The menu item to reload the TabFern window

menuOnlineInfo.description: The menu item to open the blue and yellow 'About' Web page

menuSettings.description: The menu item to open the Settings page

menuRestoreLastDeleted.description: The menu item to restore the last-deleted window

menuBackupNow.description: The menu item to save a copy of the tree to disk

menuLoadBackupContents.description: The menu item to load tree items from disk

menuSort.description: The text of the submenu with the sort options

menuSortOpenToTop.description: The sort-submenu item to sort open windows to the top

menuSortAZ.description: The sort-submenu item to sort in alphabetical order

menuSortZA.description: The sort-submenu item to sort in reverse alphabetical order

menuSort09.description: The sort-submenu item to sort in numerical order

menuSort90.description: The sort-submenu item to sort in reverse numerical order

menuExpandAll.description: The menu item to expand all trees

menuCollapseAll.description: The menu item to collapse all trees

menuToggleTopBorder.description: The context-menu item to toggle the top border on a tab's tree entry

menuAddEditNote.description: The context-menu item to add or edit a tab's note

menuAddEditNoteThisTab.message: Add/edit a note for the current tab
menuAddEditNoteThisTab.description: The extension-menu item to add or edit the current tab's note

menuRename.description: The context-menu item to rename a window's tree entry

menuForget.description: The context-menu item to mark a window as unsaved

menuttForget.message: Do not save this window when it is closed
menuttForget.description: The context-menu tooltip to mark a window as unsaved

menuRemember.description: The context-menu item to mark a window as saved

menuttRemember.message: Save this window when it is closed
menuttRemember.description: The context-menu tooltip to mark a window as saved

menuCloseAndRemember.description: The context-menu item to mark a window as saved, then close it

menuDelete.description: The context-menu item to delete a window or tab's tree item

menuURLSubstitute.description: The context-menu item to make a replacement in the URL of each tab in the window

menuttURLSubstitute.message: Make a text replacement in all of the URLs in this window

menuMoveToTop.description: The context-menu item to move a window's tree item to the top of the tree

err.example: (this is the error message from Chrome)

filename.example: (this is the file the user wanted to load)

errCouldNotRunImporter.message: Unexpected error while trying to load the file.  Error code was: $ERR$
